actions-list.actionItem: The House adjourned pursuant to a previous special order. The next meeting is scheduled for 12:00 p.m. on May 5, 2025.
On motion to adjourn Agreed to by voice vote.
Mr. Kiley (CA) moved that the House do now adjourn.
The House has concluded all anticipated legislative business and has proceeded to Special Order speeches.

actions-list.header: Board of Trustees of the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Foundation
actions-list.actionItem: Pursuant to section 4703(b) of the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Act (20 U.S.C. 4703), the Democratic Leader appointed the following member of the House to the Board of Trustees of the Barry Goldwater Scholarship and Excellence in Education Foundation: Mr. Larson of Connecticut.
The House proceeded with further one minute speeches.

Mr. LaMalfa asked unanimous consent That, when the House adjourns on Thursday, May 1, 2025, it adjourn to meet on Monday, May 5, 2025, at noon for morning-hour debate and 2:00 p.m. for legislative business. Agreed to without objection.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 246

actions-list.actionItem: Considered as unfinished business. H.J. Res. 88 — "Providing congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the Environmental Protection Agency relating to "California State Motor Vehicle and Engine Pollution Control Standards; Advanced Clean Cars II; Waiver of Preemption; Notice of Decision"."
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

actions-list.header: On passage Passed by the Yeas and Nays: 216

actions-list.actionItem: The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.
The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H.J. Res. 78.

Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 60, H.J. Res. 78, H.J. Res. 87, H.J. Res. 88 and H.J. Res. 89. The resolution provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 60, H.J. Res. 78, H.J. Res. 87, H.J. Res. 88, and H.J. Res. 89 under a closed rule with one hour of debate and one motion to recommit on each joint resolution.

Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 354. H.J. Res. 78 — "Providing for congressional disapproval under chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, of the rule submitted by the United States Fish and Wildlife Service relating to "Endangered and Threatened Wildlife and Plants; Endangered Species Status for the San Francisco Bay-Delta Distinct Population Segment of the Longfin Smelt"."
The House proceeded with one minute speeches which by direction of the Chair, would be limited to 5 per side of the aisle.
The Chair designated Mr. Correa to lead the Members in reciting the Pledge of Allegiance to the Flag.
The Speaker announced approval of the Journal.  Pursuant to clause 1, rule I, the Journal stands approved.
Today's prayer was offered by Pastor Eli Lara, New Life Family Church McAllen, Texas
The House convened, starting a new legislative day.
